Reviews.Title: tracfone has to send me a sim card but this is a nice device
Reviews.Author: Terri H
Reviews.Content: Tracfone has to send me a sim card for this phone, because it has a t-mobile sim card in it and there are no tmobile towers in my area.  But this phone is fun for a basic phone.  I love the fm radio on it.  Even if I never am able to activate it, I am having fun playing with it.You can make your own ringtones with the melody maker.Tracfone customer service is really slow and there is problems with language, cuz they are all overseas. So I feel doubtful this will ever work as a handset. But for $7.99 I don't care really because it's cute and I can use it as a radio and a toy. I have smartphones too, and two other tracfones, but this one is the best basic non smartphone I have seen at this price.Basically I don't use actual cell minutes that much. I just like to buy these cheapo tracfones every 2 months for the free 20 minutes.  This one I might keep though, cuz it's very cute and I don't feel like it comes from 1994.The pictre doesn't really show the cuteness of the phone.  The handset actually looks and feels much more polished than the picture shows.And the phone arrived right on time, with prime shipping.  So I am happy even though I have to wait for a sim card that may or may not show up.It takes pictures and video too.  It has a world clock, a calendar, alarm, calculator, task list, currency converter, etc. It has two full version games on it, and they are both basic but challenging. Copter and Chicken. I am not sure if it accepts an sd card, but it does have a menu item for sd card.I was able to take a picture on it and push it too my android phone, so it does accept object transfer via bluetooth.

Reviews.Title: Good for a month
Reviews.Author: mrdprince
Reviews.Content: This phone is excellent and has met all my needs.  Then after one month the phone has started deducting 0.03 or more minutes from my total without my using it.  Customer service by phone has cost me more than if I left it alone.  Online customer service was nice but did not solve the problem.  I really like this phone but I am not giving away money for nothing.  What to do.

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: michael vetter
Reviews.Content: Works really great, good coverage, good sound and triple minutes for life.  We use it for an emergency car phone.

Reviews.Title: no complaints
Reviews.Author: M.
Reviews.Content: As advertised, I got the Motorola EX431G Prepaid Phone With Triple Minutes, not really sure what else to say, product was delivered new, sealed, in box, charged up, works fine, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: This phone is exactly as described and works perfectly. Triple minutes for life and a great price, what a deal.

Reviews.Title: Decent phone for a cheap price
Reviews.Author: Klovie
Reviews.Content: Triple minutes for life? What's not to like about that? Great little toss away phone to use while I save up for a new one.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: BM
Reviews.Content: For the price, I'd say its a pretty good little phone for talk and text.  Seems reliable and sturdy. The rubbery-surface keys are small but convex, so you can press just the key you intend easily enough.  Its nice that it has 3G, but its not a good phone for internet - the curser pointer is just not precise enough - you often can't click exactly where you want to on the screen (like an input box).  Tracfone seems to charge a lot of minutes for web use.  Of course I wish it had WiFi, but good luck finding that feature in this price range.

Reviews.Title: phone
Reviews.Author: Sherri jarembo
Reviews.Content: Can't find accessories and a case for it so I guess its outdated a bit. But you can answer it so

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: Benton Broken "B.B."
Reviews.Content: i had a landline for about 8yrs, stripped to the bare bones; no long distance, no caller ID, 50 calls/mo., anything over i paid more for each minute. i think the most i ever made was 25-30 in a month. I dont need anything special, and this delivers exactly that. w/ triple minutes for life? i am now a phone god.with that aside, works well, cam w video and pics is great. internet access if you want it. only thing i dont like is the location of the volume button, on the right side as you face it. every time i pick it up to answer a call i inadvertently press it, so i never know if its a bad connection or probably my pushing the button.one thing about tracfone: be careful, they recycle the numbers they use. i got one number from them as soon as i bought this. when it went live i instantly started getting spam texts, and their customer service in the pakistan/afghan desert is nearly non-existent. and if you want to x-fer your info from one fone to another, you will need a 3rd fone to do that. its an unbelieveable mess, and you will not be refunded minutes you use in speaking to their customer service.need a cheap great phone? dont pass this up.

Reviews.Title: Comes with setup minutes and setup service days
Reviews.Author: Dale L. Splitstone
Reviews.Content: The package states that the phone comes with 10 setup minutes, but does not mention setup service days. When I activated I received 20 setup minutes and 60 setup service days.I purchased this phone to activate and test an LG Optimus Dynamic II (LG39C). Tracfone Android phones do not come with any setup minutes or setup service days. It is also not possible to port your service, other than phone number, to a non-Android phone if the Android phone proves unsuitable for the intended purpose. My solution was to purchase a package including this phone and a 200 minute card at a package cost of $19.99. This way I can activate the EX431G, transfer its setup minutes and setup service days to the LG39C when I activate it, and hold the 200 minute card in reserve till after I verify the LG39C is suitable. If I have to I can transfer my number back to the EX431G and reactivate it with the 200 minute card. All I would lose is the setup minutes and setup service days.This is pretty much ideal for my needs. I use an average of about 120 minutes/month. Activating the card provides me with 600 minutes and 90 service days on the Android. This is about 5 months of minutes and three months of service days. The phone itself comes with about 5 days of minutes and two months of service days. Thus, if I can use the Android I can get about 5 months worth of minutes and 5 months worth of service days. I figure $19.99 for 5 months worth of service is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Won't work
Reviews.Author: Karen Phillips
Reviews.Content: I should have known it was too good to be true, These phones won't work in my area.  But for 8 bucks its not worth the hassle to return it.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality Low Price
Reviews.Author: Darrian Tryon
Reviews.Content: I love this phone it has a camera so i can take pictures on the go without having to bring my camera with me that will zoom quite a bit and still have a decent picture. It has a slot for micro sd cards so i have more space put music and pictures .

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: husamia
Reviews.Content: The phone was free, and has good ratings. I had TF replace it with another model because it didn't get good signal.

Reviews.Title: Not good for 76549
Reviews.Author: Linda Reed
Reviews.Content: It will not work in my area even though it was supposed to.  I have contacted Tracfone several times..  Was told that it will not work on Verizon or AT & T.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Lunchtimerunner
Reviews.Content: I only got this phone for when my parents from overseas visited. I wanted to be able to reach them but not spend a lot of money; this phone was really cheap and we didn't need more for them.I love that we actually got tripe minutes with the phone; I only bought a small Tracfone card - I think 30 min but with triple minutes we got 90 minutes which was enough for us.While the phone number won't work if you don't re-load after a certain time, I am not worried about it.This would be also a great phone to give to a older person that only needs a phone in case of emergency or kids that you don't want to give a contract phone.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PHONE!
Reviews.Author: A. Baker
Reviews.Content: We live in a rural area and had a Motorola C139 and never had any trouble getting a signal inside of our home.  We decided to upgrade and bought a Samsung T404G, but we couldn't get a signal inside the house.  In fact, we had to go out in our driveway to get a signal. A friend told us that Motorolas have better antennas than Samsungs do, so I did some research on Amazon.  This cell phone was highly rated and at a very reasonable price, so we bought it.  Guess what-we can get a signal inside of our home again.  We are thrilled.  Not only that, the pictures that we take with it are much better quality than the ones taken with the Samsung.  This is a great little phone at an excellent price.  We couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Mixed
Reviews.Author: Catherine
Reviews.Content: The phone is light, but the keys are a little to small. Also, the buttons are hard to press. The call quality is good, and the coverage is great! It has amazing battery life!!! If you ask me, I would purchase this phone again!!! One more thing, the phone is really a amazing deal!

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Marji
Reviews.Content: Phone seems to work fine but the keys are very very tiny. If I had seen it in prrson I would not have bought it because of that. I haven't used all of the features yet so can't comment. But with the price and triple minutes you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: very nice phone
Reviews.Author: Tony D
Reviews.Content: I am giving only four stars because the type on the buttons are VERY hard to read. I bought this phone for my 70 yrs. Old mother who has never ever used a smart phone, but she can navigate through the operation with ease.

Reviews.Title: So far it's great!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Marie Bowe
Reviews.Content: Haven't had this phone for long but what a great deal to start! $8 phone and 60 minute card for $20 that triples to 180 minutes. It's a starter phone for my 12 year old to talk and text. Nothing fancy. Hope it lasts for a longtime time to come. My Sister will now order one for her daughter because I was talking so highly of this deal.

Reviews.Title: great deal!!!
Reviews.Author: William D. Strevel "Don"
Reviews.Content: arrived as expected, loved them!!  New condition.  I want to order more for my friends and to sell to others!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE NOT WORTH $8
Reviews.Author: Viking52889
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these phones thinking they would be a nice upgrade from the simplistic phone she has now. The phones get no service and took days to even activate. I wasn't able to make calls on it so i finally called tracfone customer service. After an hour on the phone with a customer service rep they couldn't even make them work. So now i am waiting to see if they'll even send me a replacement phone or sim card. If you want to pay $8 to waste an hour of your life by all means buy this phone, if not just avoid it altogether.

Reviews.Title: very nice little phone
Reviews.Author: Charly gilland
Reviews.Content: I had Safe Link and needed a decent phone so I bought this, liked it so much I bought another one as gift.

Reviews.Title: SERVICE CONNECTION BAD
Reviews.Author: Ed Ortman
Reviews.Content: This phone will only get service in certain buildings and even then its touch and go. would not recommend it to anyone who needs a phone.

ProductInfo.Features:
Tracfone Service
Triple Minutes for Life
2MP Camera with 4X digital zoom and Video Recorder
Bluetooth Wireless Technology
SMS and MMS Picture Messaging
ProductInfo.Name: Motorola EX431G Prepaid Phone With Triple Minutes (Tracfone)
